channel.title: Drinktober 2020 on Drinktober 2022
channel.description: Recent content in Drinktober 2020 on Drinktober 2022

item.title: The End?
item.description: So, that’s about it for Drinktober 2020 then. I don’t know about you guys, but I’ve had a lot of fun. I’m already starting to plot next year’s antics, I’m going to have to pull out quite a few stops if I want to top this one! As always, the donation site will be open for a while yet, so if you’ve been meaning to chuck something in the pot and haven’t got around to it yet there’s still time.

item.title: IT IS DONE!!
item.description: IT üëè IS üëè DONE üëè I waited until 12 to have a prosecco…..but after 2 glasses I‚Äôm done, I don‚Äôt even want to get lashed! Possibly the weirdest DrinkTober yet, with covid and a new lockdown as of today, but I‚Äôm actually feeling quite good. This is the year I‚Äôve actually enjoyed the break and felt more comfortable to not drink. Im proud of myself and feeling quite grown up.

item.title: Don't fear the reaper
item.description: And so at last we come to the final night of Drinktober 2020. It’s Drinkowe’en - the drunkest, spookiest night of the year! I hope you’ve enjoyed my ridiculous antics all month - we’re still a long way from the target so if you’ve been thinking about making a donation now’s the time to hit that link over there, right under Heidi. As for me, I’m going to enjoy a nice quiet drink outdoors - in the Garden of Death!

item.title: Art of darkness
item.description: Yesterday’s Satanic encounter left quite an impression on me. Now that I’m in league with the forces of evil, I’ve retreated to Ye Olde Wizarding Shoppe where I’ve been dabbling in the Dart Arts.

item.title: So _CLOSE_
item.description: It‚Äôs so bloody close!! one more day to go. I was initially not looking forward to this October, but I‚Äôve surprisingly enjoyed it in a funny way. Covid times are weird, so getting out walking and away from boredom drinking In front of the telly has been great (Although no walking for me for a few days due to getting a massive tattoo on my foot Yesterday!) Overall I‚Äôm looking forward to a little drink when I finish, but I‚Äôm proud of myself.

item.title: Horny
item.description: Tonight finds me working on a “special” batch of homebrew for Drinkowe’en - this terrifying concoction was made under the influence of dark forces beyond my control. It’s not my fault - the Devil made me brew it!

item.title: Does exactly what it says on the tin
item.description: What more can I say about the ghastly skeletal presence that’s appeared to host tonight’s thrilling episode? With that massive ivory bonce, it’s pretty clear he’s a bit of a Bonehead!

item.title: Rather have a piece of toast
item.description: A terrifying presence arises as the spooky shenanigans continue. I’m being haunted by a spooky ghost - and he’s nicked my beer!

item.title: Little goody two-shoes!
item.description: What has Science wrought? The synaptic transmitter was more successful than I could have imagined, but now I’m face to face with my Evil Twin! But which one is Good Jonny, and which is Bad Jonny? Good? Bad? I’m the one with the beer!

item.title: On the rocks
item.description: I like a southern comfort or a brandy on the rocks, even a cheeky gin ting too. Yesterday I was on different rocks! Apparently when I don‚Äôt spend my sundays in the pub or cleaning, I enjoy outdoors now. Even getting muddy and climbing up waterfalls, j loved it! I‚Äôm even considering buying walking boots, what‚Äôs that all about? The none drinking has helped me go out and explore and actually move which I am enjoying.

item.title: It's alive! Alive!
item.description: The mad science continues in tonight’s instalment, as I test out my new Synaptic Transmission device. Can the machine transfer my mind and bring the construct to life? We’ll just have to wait and see…

item.title: Do you wanna get high?
item.description: Tonight I’m putting the fun back into funambulism, taking to the skies to walk the high wire!

item.title: 7 days, 7 miles
item.description: Only 7 days to go!! It feels like it‚Äôs gone super fast this year. On the theme of 7‚Äôs….. I lost another 7lbs this week, so celebrated by going for a 7 mile walk. And it RAINNNNNED. I got piss wet through, but persevered, like I have with my sober challenge!

item.title: It always brings me down
item.description: Tonight sees me back in the lab and testing out my latest invention - this handy, compact anti-gravity machine, which is definitely a brand new invention and not the dream machine with a new label hastily taped to the front! As you can see, things got away from me during the first test - my beer drifted away, torn from my hands by the Wild Gravity! It’s true what they say- gravity is a harsh mistress!

item.title: Where‚Äôs October?
item.description: Where the hell has October gone?! A week and a day to go until normality can resume. Today was manic and I didn‚Äôt atop, but I didn‚Äôt actually think about having a drink, even though I had a night to myself when I‚Äôd usually treat myself. That‚Äôs personal growth right there lads! We‚Äôve not had many donations this year, despite Johnny making it the highest class DrinkTober yet. So thank you to those that have donated, and the rest of you get your hands in your pockets!

item.title: Kart load of ale!
item.description: It’s-a-me! Jonny-O! Tonight finds me racing on that most fiendish of tracks - the Rainbow Road. Luckily I’ve got a good supply of IPA power-ups to help fend off the roaming Goombas!

item.title: Dark Passenger
item.description: There are a lot of names for what I do. Monster. Maniac. Serial killer. All I know is, if you find yourself strapped to my table, the world would be a better place without you. So what does that make me? Am I an avenging angel? The hero this city deserves? Or just another American Psycho?

item.title: Smokin'
item.description: Some smoked beer really demands some smoked food to go with it, so I fired up the BBQ in the midst of October in East Yorkshire (hey, it wasn’t raining! perfect weather!) with some homemade sausage and a chicken. Very tasty it was too!

item.title: Pub ahoy!
item.description: The ultimate challenge has occurred: had a meeting in the pub tonight after work. But, I stayed strong; and had 2 diet cokes! Which weirdly are more expensive than a pint, but hey ho still cheaper than moet. I also resisted fish and chips, my only greater love than wine, so I‚Äôm chuffed I managed that despite being up at 6 with my dad been taken to a&e and work all day.

item.title: So tired. So sober.
item.description: Sooooooo tired and I have no energy! Went to give blood Today and it‚Äôs the first time it‚Äôs not been a great excuse to get drunk quicker! Overall I‚Äôm feeling better not drinking but I‚Äôm struggling to stay awake tonight: I reckon one vodka would currently knock me out anyway so I guess Viva le Sober! Also on the subject of unconventional tattoos…. I‚Äôve booked one with all the money I saved not drinking üòÇ

item.title: Stabby Stabby
item.description: What better way to celebrate the best Drinktober yet than with some commemorative body art? I’m starting to think maybe the “Ink and Dagger Tattoo Parlour” might not have been the best choice though…

item.title: Aren't you a little drunk for a Stromtrooper?
item.description: A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away… I had a beer. Tonight’s thrilling drinktober instalment sees me transported far across the galaxy and recruited into the Imperial legions.

item.title: I am a machine
item.description: Hola! Works been stressful and last night I struggled a lot to not drink. Butttttt, today I got weighed and I‚Äôve lost 6lbs, taking my total to 16lbs which made me feel better! Went walking and managed 8.2 miles today, meaning I don‚Äôt fancy a drink at all tonight! Please take a moment to donate if you can, my legs might drop off from today‚Äôs wandering so a cheeky fiver whilst I‚Äôm infirm would be üëå

item.title: Goblin it all up
item.description: See the little goblin, see his little feet! And his little nosey-wose, isn’t the goblin sweet? Yes! The little goblin drinking song A creepy figure tends to his hoard for tonight’s installment of Drinktober. Beware all you who would seek the Hobgoblin Gold, for you may find great riches but you will never escape the curse of the Wych Wood!

item.title: Tetris Terrors!
item.description: Back to the antics and facing almost certain doom tonight. I’ve arranged all these glowing blocks into a neat pattern, and for my troubles I’m about to be crushed under this giant beer! I guess that’ll teach me to try to Tessellate…

item.title: Please God give me a gin.
item.description: Jesus Christ I wanted a drink tonight!! I could on practically taste it. I spent a moment gazing at the prosecco at my corner shop waving my bank card and probably looked a bit not ok. Frustrating day of stupid Expensive internet Dropping out and losing my work, followed by a 2 hour rowing with a smart plug which wouldn‚Äôt work and I would probably kill your nan for a drink about now.

item.title: Where the grass is green
item.description: Bit of a quiet one for the 15th of Drinktober. Tonight I’m enjoying a can of Paradise City from Tiny Rebel :)

item.title: Sweet dreams are made of beer
item.description: Who am I to disagree? I’ve been hard at work in my secret lab working on this latest invention. Now, by harnessing the power of SCIENCE!!! my Dream Machine allows me to see inside my dreams. The results are… well, somewhat predictable.

item.title: Well Jesus Christ
item.description: Well, that was a few days. Sent to work from home because I‚Äôve developed a bizarre hives like rash type affair EVERYWHERE….. which apparently is a covid sign. Also, I‚Äôve developed random sporadic vomiting today, WITHOUT EVEN HAVING AN ALCOHOL. Wtf?!! So I am currently very itchy, a bit nauseous, and with a headache from 11 and a half hours on zoom meeting, and a little drink would be bloody fantastic.

item.title: What's better than some beer?
item.description: More beer more beer more beer more! Drink! Drink! Drink! Till you drink no more! Ravenage - More beer Almost 2 weeks into Drinktober and it’s been quite a ride so far. As you can see, all this beer is starting to take it’s toll, so there’s only one thing that can fix it… MORE BEER!

item.title: Wilmaaaaaaaaa!
item.description: Another trip back in time for the 12th of Drinktober. It’s clocking-off time in Bedrock so I’m sliding down the back of my dinosaur ready to head home. Yabbadabbadoo!

item.title: Zzzzz
item.description: Day counts on fingers 12, almost 13!! And I‚Äôm surprisingly ok, barring the odd ‚Äúoh I could have a glass of….never mind‚Äù thoughts I‚Äôm alright! I‚Äôm tired, but less tired than usual. This is the first year I‚Äôve not been tearing my hair out by week 2, I‚Äôm shocked how well I‚Äôm doing!? Someone have a party and tempt me to make it harder, I‚Äôm sick of grouting things!

item.title: For those about to drink
item.description: ‘Cause I shoot to thrill, and I’m ready to kill I can’t get enough, I can’t get my fill I shoot to thrill, play to kill Yeah, pull the trigger AC/DC - Shoot to Thrill Tonight I’m crashing the stage with rock legends AC/DC to fire my Big Gun.

item.title: Do you like movies about gladiators?
item.description: My name is Citrus Maxima. Commander of the armies of the Hops. General of the zesty Legions, loyal servant of the brew Emperor. Drinker of a finished pint, holder of an empty glass. And I will have my beer, in this pub or the next! Stepping back in time for the 10th of Drinktober, to the days of Ancient Rome, where the mighty gladiator Citrus Maxima conquered the arena and toppled an empire.

item.title: Never walked in my life unless it‚Äôs to the pub
item.description: I am back! Didn‚Äôt post yesterday because I managed to lock myself out of the website: something that‚Äôs a common occurrence when drunk but I‚Äôm not sure how I managed it sober. 10 whole days in and I‚Äôve lost 10lbs which is rather nice. Can‚Äôt say I‚Äôve saved money because my house is falling down but still, I‚Äôll take it! Today as oppose to my usual leisurely walk to the pub (the extent of my normal walking) I went on an actual solo wander which ended up being quite a treck through a housing estate, a tiny forest, some nice hills and some ropey garages.

item.title: Ich habe Space Dementia
item.description: What’s that there? I don’t care Sat alone, with no cards, playing solitaire Breathe cold air, fuel’s spent yeah Ich habe space dementia Space Dementia, Evil Scarecrow I’ve been blasted into the deep space for the 9th of Drinktober, courtesy of Arbor Ales’ Space Hardware. I think the isolation has sent me a bit funny - am I really seeing Neville the space hedgehog or has my mind succumbed to Space Dementia?

item.title: All cracked up
item.description: This wasn’t quite what I meant by a night on the tiles! For the 8th of Drinktober, I’ve got a nice big can of Mosaic ale.

item.title: I need you to kill me
item.description: I really fancy a booze tbh. I‚Äôve had a bastardo of a day, I‚Äôve not stopped and I‚Äôm still on the grouting mission so everything hurts and I would put my face through a window for a little vat of wine. I could drink it in the bath when I look at my grout. send help.

item.title: All washed up
item.description: I’ve been attacked by sea monsters, and hurled into the deep by an ungrateful crew, but at last, my nautical adventure comes to a happy ending, as I’ve washed up on this Tropical island. Now to enjoy a few tasty beers among the palm trees with my little parrot buddy Iago. Cheers!

item.title: A worrying development
item.description: Today‚Äôs the first day I fancied a drink, which had led to a somewhat worrying development. To keep me occupied, I have now replaced having a relaxing glass of wine with DIY. Today we have had a light fitted, ripped down a ceiling and it‚Äôs now 11pm and I‚Äôm removing all the grout from the bathroom tiles. Is this healthy? Where will this end? Will we survive?!!!! Also my feet hurt, my hand is black And I have a significant amount of plaster in my hair and tit region.

item.title: Mutiny!
item.description: Gather round and listen to this tale of treachery upon the high seas. It seems my shipmates took offence to my language yesterday, in the middle of the night those mutinous dogs dragged me from my bunk and tossed me overboard. I managed to save myself from Davey Jones’ locker by lashing a raft together from some driftwood, but now I’m a castaway, adrift upon the Big Sea.

item.title: With a what now?
item.description: Fuck! You! You’re a fucking wanker! We’re gonna punch you right in the balls! Fuck! You! With a fucking anchor! You’re all cunts so fuck you all! Alestorm - Fucked with an anchor Stretching the theme a little bit for the 5th of Drinktober, but I couldn’t resist the opportunity to combine three of my favourite things. Pirate costumes, heavy metal and gratuitous swearing! Sing along, ye scurvy dogs!

item.title: Well that was a challenge
item.description: I‚Äôve survived a challenge! Most of you people know I‚Äôm a little….. funny. I‚Äôm quite OCD and if things aren‚Äôt right or tidy, expect a breakdown. I‚Äôm also an emotional drinker: annoyed? Have a brandy. Happy? Have a champers. Stressed? Vat of wine and an absolut chaser. So yesterday I didn‚Äôt manage a post, but I did have half my kitchen ceiling down fixing a leaking lead pipe, plaster all over, half my bathroom taken out and no electric due to my dodge lighting.

item.title: It's time to get Loco!
item.description: For the 4th of Drinktober we step into the ring with the mighty El Loco - the most feared luchador in all of East Yorkshire! Undefeated in every match, this fearsome hero of the ring strikes terror into the hearts of his opponents, and loves nothing more than to celebrate a successful match with a victory beer!

item.title: Water leaks from the ceiling and you also have to drink it
item.description: Ok day three, whatcha got? Well we all know I‚Äôm a prolific stress drinker. So today I had a small paddy that my house is essentially falling down, nothing works and my pipes (Which are leaking) are made of lead (apparently this is bad). So I realllllly fancied some wine, or 9 double vodkas of something . However, I‚Äôve stayed strong and drank water all goddamn day. Which is slightly less appealing to drink when it‚Äôs slowly dripping from your ceiling.

item.title: What a lovely day!
item.description: Beer. Beer never changes. When the old world fell, only a few survived. Roaming the blacktop between the remnants of the cities, scavenging for the last remaining booze of a lost civilisation. A drop of ale in the wasteland can help keep a man sane - because if you don’t keep your head… you’re nothing but Roadkill… Things are going a little bit post-apocalyptic for the 3rd of Drinktober as I take to the roads of the blasted wasteland that was once Yorkshire in search of more beer.

item.title: Looking a little pale
item.description: A fairly quiet one for the second of Drinktober. I’m hard at work in the Beercave prepping for the insanity to come, just taking a break to enjoy a tasty Rudgate Pale. Tune in tomorrow, same beer time, same beer channel, when we start to kick things up a notch!

item.title: DAY 2!
item.description: Day 2, feeling confident! Day one was a piece of piss because I was ill, so I slept through my normal drinking time! So far today I‚Äôm on 5 coffees, a herbal tea and 4 waters, might be piddling for England but sober af! üôåüèª

item.title: Back once again with the Drunken Master
item.description: It’s the first of Drinktober, and I should be working hard on getting everything set up for this year’s shenanigans, but instead here I am just chilling in my hammock with a nice cold lager. I guess I’m just a Lazy Boy ;)

item.title: Drinktober 2020 Trailer
item.description: Here’s the official video trailer for Drinktober 2020. Enjoy!

item.title: Drinktober 2020 - Lockdown lock-in!
